result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] was dismissed by the court.

  • John H Felton was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
A withheld sentence, eighteen (18) months probation and mandatory minimum jail as a condition of probation. Entrance into and completion of the OWI Court program as a condition of probation. 
----------------------
Concurrent with: 14CT282

miscConds.notes:
$600.00 fine plus costs. THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE. Payment is due within 30 days. If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan. Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines/costs as ordered. *NOTE: fine may be increased to $1,200.00 fine plus costs, if probation is revoked.
----------------------

Pursuant to sec. 973.046(1r), the defendant is required to pay $200.00 DNA surcharge.
---------------------
**AMENDED ON 07-24-2015 TO REFLECT THE CORRECT AMOUNT OF DNA SURCHARGE FOR FELONY CONVICTION IN THE AMOUNT OF $250.00.**
---------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
-------------------

Defendant MUST follow all OWI Court Program, Jail and Probation rules with no violations. Any violation of rules or failure to adhere to treatment requirements could mean removal from the OWI Court Program, revocation of probation, and an immediate imposition of the remaining jail sentence. Such sentence MUST be served within the Walworth County Huber Facility.
----------------------

Conditions of participation will include drug/alcohol screens and complete meaningful compliance with ALL treatment programming and attendance at OWI Court sessions. This includes a requirement of no alcohol or drug use.
--------------------

Defendant is to attend Victim Impact Panel.
-------------------
**AMENDMENT 07-24-2015 - DEFENDANT MUST SUBMIT DNA SAMPLE AND PAY $250.00 SURCHARGE.**

timeConds.notes:
Initial mandatory minimum jail sentence to be completed at the Walworth County jail Huber Facility. This conditional jail time may be served on electronic monitoring at the discretion of the Walworth County Jail.
--------------------
Consecutive to: 14CT282

supervisions.notes:
THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.-------------------------------------------
**10/13/2016 - The Judgment of Conviction has been CORRECTED to reflect that the defendant is NOT eligible for CIP and IS eligible for SAP.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol.   Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
-------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis unless previously provided. 
-------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
-------------------------------
Court ordered financial obligations have been paid in full.
